k8fXFCCmpZYS9c8sC7INzQ.text: Just had a terrible experience, waited over 30 min for lunch all the while people who had ordered after were getting their food.  I kindly asked 3 times where our food was and why other people where getting food before us.  The woman then asked the cook for our order and still 10 min later no food.  They ended up giving a discount which was nice but I'd rather have had my food in a timely manner.

12EhBHIWX-gSnviCU1Kj5g.text: All I can say is OHHHHH-MYYYYY-GOOOSSSHHHHHH!! I've been looking for a spot like this in Chandler!! This is BY FAR theeeeee BEST street tacos I've had around this area. I would HIGHLY recommend Los Taquitos to everyone. The street tacos are PHENOM!

TVqDWjQhy9tBzTY8cuFRjQ.text: Thought it might be glorified fast food when trying for the first time but was pleasantly surprised. The lengua street tacos for $1.75 each were delicious; the meat was moist, flavorful, and plentiful. Filling flavors were well balanced and spiced. My friend enjoyed her carnitas tacos, saying they were succulent and had plenty of meat. The "pre-made" house margaritas on the rocks were surprisingly good and $4 during happy hour. They have covered outside seating at picnic tables. You order at the counter, and they bring your order to you. Service is friendly and fast, and the interior is large with plenty of seating. This will be a regular stop.

b53J4Y50oFHdYTO4OLbSiA.text: Excellent gluten free options.  I enjoyed the street tacos.  The beef adobo was my favorite. Really tasty and good rice &beans. The chicken was good but I preferred the beef. They use tilapia for the fish, so I didn't have any.  The offer an green and red sauce both were spicy.  Excellent price less than $2 per street taco.  I had the combo with beans and rice.  Really cute decor.  The paintings are really colorful and fun.  I didn't have any but they serve margaritas etc   Our server Veronica was well Informed about gluten free options and was very helpful and friendly

933MEIlbPligpdhDsR9C3g.text: I visited this location for the first time this week. I had previously been to the Elliot rd location and only had the breakfast burritos there.  They were fantastic so I stopped here to pick up dinner for my husband and myself after work.   Service was friendly and time was appropriate for a "to go" order.  Street tacos were awesome -had the al pastor and they had great flavor. We also had the super nachos. We didn't add any meat to them but I will do so next time. I also ordered the chile relleno.   No complaints - the only feedback was the that the bin of limes only had two left and they looked a little sad :). It was close to the end of the night so I'm sure that's why it hasn't been refilled.  Overall, the meal was great and we will be returning.

89h3oDTTrhGgpqkcD1vGCQ.text: Not a good value. Burrito bowl mostly chicken, not much else. Rice undercooked and a few hard ones. Sauces nothing special and not labeled. Pico mostly onion, few tomatoes.

-caN3mjRQQ5dO_wJZqp1eQ.text: This is a great new find in our neighborhood. When you first walk in your eyes are excited with all the bright murals beautifully painted throughout the restaurant. From there the menu is very simple and to the point. My family happened to go on taco Tuesday and we were able to only spend $24 for 3 adults. This will for sure be our new taco stop. Make sure to try the carne tacos!

bJ0hg1A3SJAiTFPw3NwE0g.text: This is one my favorite taco places for sure.  The al pastor tacos are amazing.  The customer service is above average.  We go for taco tuesdays 2-3 times a month and we have never had a bad experience.  Definitely worth giving it a try.

bMmxhGHFi7evnQwpWeq8xA.text: Great place for taco Tuesday, I would give them 5 stars but my friend got a piece of hair in her food. From what I could see through there window, the women were not wearing hair nets. They gave her a new plate but didn't say sorry for the hair, and they gave her 3 tacos when she ordered four. Otherwise it was a nice visit. Examine your food before you take a bite.

WC0Z6Akfb9h5zEq0kq0FrQ.text: If you like rubbery chicken in your tacos and fish tacos with a pound of salt in it then you are gonna fall in love with this place....The beans and rice served with tacos tasted like as if they have been prepared a month ago....Really bad food...I ordered prickly pear margarita (which was very strong) with the shitty food which made my dinner bit tolerable...so, if you wanna eat here, first get drunk with their margarita only then you'll be eat their food.

UbkUt6uL0nla83G1ydLGlg.text: This place has excellent carne asada, either in a taco or or burrito. Fish tacos are delightful and remind me of what I find in beach towns in Cali and Mexico. Their salsa is distinctive and the wall art is not to be missed.

cZqxIlk_zHni5dmDNXso5A.text: Yum! Taco Tuesday $1 but on other days they are $1.75. Great selection -asada, carnita, pastor, lengua, fish - all of them are great Best red menudo in phoenix and it's served everyday Kids menu is great! Reasonable prices

xG6GN5itb-tEnVVuYtaL4w.text: Food and service are always good. Margaritas are VERY tasty. It's a favorite of my picky teenager.

3n1uHcDpNkNlwBBVSGqJdg.text: Let me just preface by saying I HATE leaving bad reviews. I feel bad doing it. However, this place warrants it. I called in my order on taco Tuesday and was informed it would be 30 min before it was ready. No problem, I understand. I put in two orders, but the person on the phone couldn't give me our totals because she was in the back room. Ok again, no harm done. When we got there only one order was ready. One of the women behind the counter was unfriendly the other just seemed disheveled. My 4 taco order was mashed into a tiny paper bag (why not a plate?) 3 tacos in one aluminum foil (?!). The communication about the second order was lacking, but after asking a couple times we were told the unfriendly one would put it together right now. As for the taste- I'd put it at a 2. The tortillas had an strange sour taste, the shrimp was overcooked, and the beans were just odd. I was going to eat them anyway, but I found two pieces of something I can't define in there. Looked like small worms though I'm hoping they're not. Straight to the trash. Tacos were eaten reluctantly. This place ought to shape up because the whole experience was no good.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

mgcqMsIjjINWhaakacMRYg.text: Delicious food and sauces. The service was a tad slow but not unbearable. We will be back.

sZeDT_npphqu4IHAHvP-AA.text: Really good street tacos and if you like spicy try the habanero salsa. My wife really loved the margaritas and they have a super friendly staff.

VjVxQ8GBzNz6z_D1bSNMIA.text: Second time visiting this location. Family of four were very pleased with our lunch. Normally my stomach does not agree with beans but it has not made any noise since we left there. Everything was very tasty and fresh. Only request, the kids meal steak taco could use some garnishing. My daughter was asking why it was just a corn tortilla and meat. I just put lime juice and hot sauce on it for her. A few tomatoes and cabbage or lettuce would help :)

FS66v8PPAdtRN3izaAdkGg.text: Normally go to phx location, near my work. Seen this was opened near where I live. Definitely needed to stop in always good food!! Tacos burritos and quesadilla are the best. Great wall art as Well! Don't past this place up!

EhQW1zfVH31GxXnl65MJpQ.text: I'm from Mexico and you can hardly find a clean and simple taste like this taquitos. There are many places with great food, but many of them with too much condiments,  this concept and the food taste is good. The horchata water has the right cinnamon taste. Tortillas are not good. The pinto beans are "street beans" flavor.  The chicken tacos are my favorite. Sometimes the food comes out a bit salty, but overall it's good fast-food. The 2 choice of salsas compliment very well!

aHL7p_pZVlTddLYVqRs07w.text: The food Is the delicious! And the atmosphere is awesome but the overall experience would be a lot better if the girl taking your order was actually nice.

S9RVd4RzyLr5zEqd3FEVFQ.text: I go here about 3 times a week. Love the vibe and the the chicken tacos are amazing. Their hibiscus juice is really good . And the green sauce is great on everything . It's by far my fav taco place

b3MkvyopbK5WuO5pY9Wk8w.text: I wanna give these guys a great review but I'm lazy. So I'll just say that I'm picky when it comes to the type of "Mexican" restaurant I go to. I like authentic hole in the wall restaurants rather than something nice like this place, but this place really impressed me. I was in the area and hungry for some menudo/pozole and tacos. I ordered 1 asada taco and 1 lengua, al pastor quesadilla with rice and beans (to share and take home) and a pozole. My spouse got 2 tacos and menudo. The meat was perfect, all of it. The tortillas could have been just a bit more warmer but it's alright the food went down to my belly in less than 3 minutes I think. Just so you know at this point I stopped being lazy and I'll continue with more about this place. The pozole was just on point with all the condiments to go with it. Menudo was just as good fyi I like my caldo's spicy so I put chili and oregano for more flavor. The green and red salsa both have a unique kick to them so I appreciated both. Oh and I'm eating my left over quesadilla now and it's bomb!!!! Last but not least the service was great and I also enjoyed the tv's!

18dMFJhp4k6zVD6vL42UPg.text: I have an unhealthy obsession with breakfast burritos and this place makes incredible ones. My favorite is the bacon but the chorizo is also good. They have a great Taco Tuesday. If you are looking for good comfort Mexican food definitely check this place out.

Iq5Q8qSgVITU6P6oeW4WAA.text: A few years ago when they only had the Ahwatukee location, the food was really good. Homemade beans, fresh rice, good food. The food blows now, my husband and I went the other day, he ordered 3 carne asada street tacos w/rice and beans, and the only thing good on the plate were the tacos. The rice was clearly reheated, and I could tell since the rice was clumped together and getting cold. The refried beans clearly came from a can, dumped into a frying pan or what not, and then heated. They tasted just like the canned beans from Food city. My mom makes authentic Mexican food and it taste nothing like Los Taquitos. What a shame...

r4l4XRTBYtDbO_YtV9JKtA.text: Los Taquitos might have earned four stars if it was located in the Midwest, but here it is nothing special. The interior is interesting. This location used to be a Qdoba, and later, a forgettable burger joint. There is plenty of space, and I thought it was interesting how all of their chairs are a little different. It gives the place some color and character.  I enjoyed the street tacos (carne asada and shrimp). I especially liked the carne asada, which paired well with the red salsa. They don't have much of a salsa selection here -- a red and a green -- neither of which is particularly impressive.   What is keeping me from returning is their portion sizes. I ordered the street taco combo and added another taco. I still left pretty hungry. I'm not a big guy (5'9, 172), and I think I'm finished growing outside of what I accomplish in the weight room (25 years old), but I would probably need to spend around $15 here to leave satisfied. That is not ideal with so many quality Mexican restaurants around.

9LlCelntP_buQYxsd8b-6Q.text: The food here is surprisingly good, as a rule of thumb there's usually a correlation at a fast-food Mexican restaurant where the crummier the building is the better the food is, this place is one of the exceptions. It's usually pretty clean inside when they're not in the middle of a rush, and when it gets busy it can sometimes take a while to get your order but I'd say it's worth the wait. The asada tacos are my usual go to, the refried beans here are different but in a good way, and I recently gave the super nachos a try, what a generous portion those are, the guac is pretty solid too and the horchata has a stronger cinnamon flavor than some other places but it's good. I've only been disappointed two times in the dozen or so times I've been here, the side order of chips I got were a little too salty once and the pastor tacos come with pineapple and they must've used the core for the pieces I got because it was impossible to chew. Those 2 instances aside I've come back a few time since and will continue to do so. Friendly staff too.

mg833sEHrVDTT336wD3RlQ.text: First visit ordered carne Asada burrito  and fish and shrimp street tacos. They were all very good. Green sauce good and quick on preparation

FkNDuxTjLcWtmW2s2KetDQ.text: Often, while I'm at work, we get food from Los Taquitos. It always tastes amazing and it never takes more than 20 minutes to get our food. Would eat their food everyday if I could.

DG8i0JO3nN-L_qcy39vsAw.text: Alexis rocks and so do the tacos!   We tried almost all of the tacos and they were all muy delicioso! Even the tongue! The shrimp cocktail is fantastic and definitely try a michelada and the pomegranate margarita!   Make sure you give Alexis a smile for us, she deserves it because she definitely made us laugh while we were there. Well done, Los Taquitos!

ys6tD3IH6xa75rW6Z50l1Q.text: Awesome tasting food, looking forward to Taco Tuesday $1 Carnitas, Al Pastor and Chicken. Jamaica and Horchata taste really good. Thanks Guys for making something so simple, taste good. Others tend to mess it up a lot. Thumbs up

szgAzOxGCawpnepkCyOL5A.text: After loving this place for years I'm surprised to be writing this review. The quality of this place has been going downhill for awhile now though. $1 Taco Tuesday switched to $1.75 Taco Tuesday which isn't even really a deal anymore for how small the tacos are. Tonight was the real disappointment though. $20 for two burrito bowls that were no better than Chipotle....hell maybe even no better than Taco Bell. Boring, bland, and with zero real redeemable qualities. They get the three stars for their former glory as the place I used to rave about. Will definitely be finding a new Mexican go to place.

dGPNYMVHt3Z9CRcB3aQN5w.text: Awesome burrito place!  The food here is relatively cheap and has pretty good flavor.  The only downside I can about the food is that the burritos are not big compared to other places in town.  Not to say that's a bad thing, if you're trying to each smaller portions, but who does that for Mexican food?  Decor is nice and overall clean.  I'll definitely be back since it's super close to my house.

Tez4R_eOXcT4Fkl_fXwK6A.text: This is my favorite taco place. I'm at the Ahwatukee location just about every taco tuesday. It gets very busy so it's best to order ahead, but they never ever disappoint.

RBYaraf-sfkv5JUshs0rMQ.text: This place has the best tacos in town. Same great food as the original location in Ahwatukee but in a bigger and brighter location. I love all their tacos, the meat is always cooked perfectly and each one has it's own unique flavor. It is great that they now have fish tacos as well. The only thing that keeps them from 5 stars is that I wish they would have real plates and glassware for the dine-in customers. So much trash and waste from all the styrofoam and plastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

nyCsZN0luK8qoFM8EaLmQw.text: A great place for quick authentic Mexican food.  The ceviche tostada a must have.  Delicious and spicy. The horchata is also a must try and refills.

AkvBu1MuJfBIy6ThNOeY3A.text: Best Carnita tacos hands down. Never dissapointed with any of the food here. Highly recommend trying this place out.

LVj0LWc3xSj5K92ohVxVSQ.text: While it sickens me to write this because I tell everyone about this place but the other day I come in and order some tacos and a nacho. Im waiting for my order and once its done i go uo to pick it up only to hear the girl that just took my money, servered me my drink which she had to open and the food that she servered says "I shouldnt be here I have Strep throat". Are you kidding me im walking back to my seat like no way. Then she goes to the back where the foods being made and comes back out. The lady that looks like shes in charge says you can go home and she says no ill stay and starts taking orders again. I cant believe how someone has no care in the world a out others. I will never go back and ill never tell anyone anything good about this place. Please do not contact me about what you can do to fix it either. A proper manager would have made her leave as soon as they knew!!

N5DRrYnhVnjy1uTM65ztQw.text: I ordered a Carne Asada burrito,  it was good sized,  and very tasty.  The place has a nice atmosphere,  I'll have to go back. This place is worth a visit.

dMx5TO-eLZxHqDjB7guM1g.text: 3 1/2 would be more accurate. Decent food, unhappy wait staff. Been here 3 times and every time no one seems happy to be there. Bummer because they could be a lot more popular. Hash Kitchens going to hurt them when they open.

aziKSvSug5DuILxduScfZQ.text: The food is decent, the women up front tend to be rude , and complain right to you. Kinda unprofessional,  but i am a repeat customer because of the breakfast burritos.

SMdgqRtghIV8oS3ff7LwBg.text: Read a critique that complimented the fish. And shrimp tacos and another about ceviche well my friend ordered all three sooo good so delish washed down with margarita left there with breakfast burrito for tomorrow's breakfast and side of refried beans had to taste before getting home regreso por mas y mas!

K3L00l-JwkDIW3iuBVHNJw.text: Staff is nice,food came out quick,pozole was good. Didn't really care for the asada but the carnita tacos my wife got where very good. We will come back. I'll try the menudo next time around. Michelada was good also my wife's prickly pear margarita was a bit on the very sweet side. Tortillas where very good on the tacos. All around place is good thank you .

r31FHP67BHuJfXc78uH9OA.text: Awesome tacos and service. Eat there at least once a week!!  Brought family from out of town and they loved it. Carne Asada and Pastor are my favorite.

0278DK6rhG5dgolcifkg-w.text: Come here for Taco Tuesday's!  The Al Pastor taco is my fave, especially with their red salsa. The red salsa is spicy and I love the kick to it, but if you're a person who does not like spicy then I would recommend the green salsa.

vNy_XvPOlqbliwx7Hubr2w.text: Items Ordered: (2) Carne Asada Taco Plates w/ Rice & Bowl of Pozole + Sodas    Total Bill:  $26.05  Satisfaction Level: It was better than okay.  Quick Tips:   - Pozole is served Sat/Sun.  We have a lot of favorite tacos places so its really hard to put this up near the top after one visit but this spot did have pozole since it was a Saturday and that's definitely a plus.  The broth could have had a little more spice but the meat was amazing and in large chunks.  Definitely recommend.  The carne asada tacos were good as well.  The meat was tender and still juicy.  Many people mentioned they are small but they are street tacos.  That's how they are suppose to be.  Rice wasn't anything to write home about but the sauces were good.  Overall the food was great, just didn't notice anything that set it apart.

0Xyfgot91NL-hPZuU6MxpQ.text: Great customer service, pretty clean place & if you like carne asada burritos you have to try one here haha... trust me!

nVW1Ae77Pdk56DQZmPOErQ.text: So yummy!! I got the 3 asada tacos plate and it was so good. I'll def be back. Atmosphere is cool and very clean.

i_EL44VclLQCaNKKo2dmfA.text: Stopped in for breakfast burritos for the "team" at work. 9 burritos and they all came out right and labeled. Thx so much.  They open at 8 am.  The chorizo was good too. :)

2Shhi7Muj11QfeCbhRMYAg.text: Great food cool staff and a really cool place to hang out with friends and have a few drinks. Recently went there with my wife and kids and everyone had a great time. Definitely recommend this place to everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

awZt9X9_p_UCFFecSBX-hw.text: Sometimes I choose where I want dinner based on what I want to drink. I wanted a prickly pear margarita.  And I got the last one. Boom.  I also wanted a pomegranate margarita but they ran out of margarita mix. :(  Some good eats going on here.  I had the chile rellenos with rice and beans ($7) and it was great.  It was super cheesy and had excellent flavor.  The sauce paired with the poblano pepper led to a sweeter tasting dish which was great.  The rice was fluffy and not overcooked or mushy like other places and the beans had good flavor.  The red sauce they offer is also amazing and has quite the kick.  I also liked the warm flour tortilla served on the side with my chile rellenos.  That prickly pear margarita... strong.  That tequila got the Asian glow going!  The shrimp burrito with rice and beans ($9) was also decent.  Still not as good as my favorite burrito place but it was good.  Los Taquitos is an adorable place featuring some gorgeous art murals on the wall. Mismatched chairs fill up the space and there's plenty of lighting for your Yelp pics. Staff is friendly and the food comes out super hot. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sugar skull artwork is gorgeous!
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prickly pear margarita.
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chile rellenos plate with rice and beans.

WCfQv6YFEnGD56Eg3kDirw.text: A new location same great flavors plus a patio. Ever want to dine al fresco (not in the summer) and enjoy a great fish burrito or secret off the menu chillie rellno burrito?  Than this new location of Los Taquitos is for you. Affordable quality Mexican food in a fast casual setting. Some times not as fast as you would like but quality can take time.  I love the fish burrito as the grilled Mahi is full of flavor and pairs with pico de gallo and rice, it is a semi healthier option.

oWRvcsdcGWgH8ajzGro5aw.text: Good Mexican Food.  Pozole is excellent! Tacos de lengua too. Horchata is natural from scratch, good!

KaH032rLQZjnQmaYTTSEeg.text: highly recommended great tasting Mexican restaurant, , thankful this restaurant opened here in our neighborhood. Service is great. Friendly people. And it's authentic!! Check it out. ! Breakfast burrito and taco Tuesday awesome. Great   chips and guacamole , chili Relleno , you won't be disappointed

kBQ4KpTxXQrTin4XYDn4ZQ.text: Los taquitos is great for a street tacos craving and they also serve alcohol if you need to take the edge off.  The pastor taco is very tasty and the art murals on the way are awesome to observe.  Make sure though if you want tacos ala carte without beans and rice you need to specifically tell them or else the add it on automatically, (womp womp).  Anyway this is a great tacos spot and it's quick!

f_RFHWDkEuRv0LF5G4geBQ.text: Al pastor done right! I loved the food at the Ahwatukee location and was excited that they opened a restaurant in Chandler. I was famished and ordered an al pastor burrito combo to go. It was made in only a few short minutes and I was on my way!  The burrito was as good as I remember the al pastor at the Ahwatukee location. The marinated pork was tender with a slight amount of crispness along the edges. The flavor was deep, rich, earthy, with a tropical twist from the addition of pineapple. It was hearty and packed with meat, onions and sauce. The rice and beans were good too, and I was stuffed after eating half my meal. The total was a little less than $10. The order didn't come with any napkins or forks/knives in my to-go bag but since I was going straight home it was OK.  This location has a nicer layout and is newer so it's a definite winner for tasty Mexican food in Chandler.

Axt62_WVxIhGydyDvySiJw.text: This is always a lunch option for me whenever I'm in Chandler. They are very consistent and I can count on getting some quality tacos when I'm there.

82dq9xTFeQwX6l0fo9qyng.text: Very good street tacos.  The meat was a little dry, but it was flavorful.  Rice and beans were superb.  Tell your friends about Los Taquitos.

zhUppkNN9-3ZBdxvjlQR_w.text: Changing my review from a 3 to to five since they have impressed me the last few times I've come in. Service is great, store is clean, food is fresh, made to order and tastes great! Love the tender, melt in your mouth carnitas street tacos. Grilled fish is also delicious. Rice and beans are also very tasty. Come on Tuesdays as most street tacos are $1!

8OwzifnUMgSEhj08OmTgtA.text: I wish I was closer to this place! I would be here every week.  Great food and great prices, with great service!

TRx-Fy2qWH22gu83nooImQ.text: It's a casual place that's nice and clean inside with amazing tacos! Seating waa comfy. It took about 15 to 20 min to get my order on a Friday night but it was so worth it! I had a taco platter: carne asada, al pastor, and fish. All were delicious. I loved that the fish wasn't fried. The steak for the asada was great quality and juicy. The pastor was pretty flavorful. The rice and beans were also really good. Most taco places can have really good tacos but their rice and beans suck- this place knocked it out of the park everything. Note that the beans are whole pinto. Their salsas were awesome and spicy. Great place to satisfy your Mexican food craving.

clX9CXqyi2p-qDKMJbe5zw.text: I'm from NM and have been searching for a good bowl of pozole.  Well I've finally found something really close from a tip by a friend.  It's not really spicy but you can add some of their red sauce.  Only $6 for bowl.  Great deal and great food.

QpexeuEb2izazr-kdL1q3A.text: 2nd location, it's a Triple D spot, so you know it's good if Guy Fieri came by. :) I didn't know this 2nd location opened until i ran into it a couple weeks ago. Just ate there today and the service is friendly as usual, food is great, as usual! Had the street tacos, a fish, shrimp and carne, they were great. Carne asada Quesadilla was great, my husband had the Al Pastor burrito and loved it. Margaritas were great too, we'll be back soon!

5n5AvUSkVUZJhi0vxCqsag.text: I have been eating at Los Taquitos for years and oddly haven't reviewed them.  This is their new location they don't disappoint.  They have SOLID street tacos.   And wait for it, they will do the unthinkable and let you have FLOUR tortillas of you like!!!  Always a great afternoon snack; a bottle of coke and 4 street tacos (I go for pastor, lengua, asada and shrimp).

r2kaDZR48n1ymZJ6vABZfQ.text: Love this place and am so glad they opened a mile from my house! Last night I had the green chili pork bowl, man was it delicious but better than that was the happy hour house margarita! Crazy great!  I will be back over and over.  I personally would like it if they opened at 6 am for breakfast then I could go there before golf.

Za7NsHC5ij-bmp39XGJ83Q.text: We tried Los Taquitos over the weekend.  We had the green chili pork burrito with a shrimp, pollo and asada taco.  The burrito was very tasty, lots of flavor and not too spicy.  Tacos were small (street tacos). They came with beans and rice.  I wanted black beans but don't remember if I ordered them or not but when we got home, we had refried... They were ok... Nothing special.    I would recommend the green chili pork burrito!!

8X70lAbNdOGYRWCmS4XjKQ.text: Pretty good! I love the carnitas tacos with the red sauce. Taco Tuesday's are great to get a bunch of tacos for super cheap

2yosp6aMIDiNNSEAIhqxPg.text: I'm confused...it's called Los Taquitos, but they don't have any Taquitos?!  Super bummed, but everyone else gave great reviews so I order Carnitas street tacos with rice and beans.  Carnitas meat was ok but nothing special.  The beans & rice were flavorless so I tossed them.  There were two containers of sauce on the counter, neither of which were labeled, but the red one had "7 AM" written on it so I passed.    I'd heard really good things about this place so I'm disappointed.  Guess if I want my authentic Mexican food I will continue going to Espo's!

iJGHWaQg3qynRfS7gxzrSQ.text: Its a walk up counter and sit down kinda place. Not what I was expecting but the pork tacos were very good the chicken was just ok for me that is.

FelUg2QaHZ-Fn9l1KT7ECg.text: It's basically like chipotle but you don't pick your own stuff. You order it and they cal you up later.  The food is super average. I would say maybe on par with Chipotle but a tiny bit cheaper.  Other than the Taco Tuesday's for $1 I do t see much reason to go back. Other than to hit the restaurant 2 doors down which has bomb build your own pizza.

UIU2czY3dUkN01p-7ccN5Q.text: Once I find another place with street tacos, I will no longer frequent this place. Everytime I have come, there have been errors in the order. This last one was on taco Tuesday and I was charged full price with no explanation. Poor customer service

vWfQ2MWe0LKjKyXe4tVnlg.text: So pumped to have LosTaquitos in the neighborhood! Best tacos and burritos in Chandler hands down- and the tortas are one of a kind. I love the pastor, carne asada and shrimp!   This will be my new go-to for a quick, delicious homemade meal. 5 stars!

o-rxlVCoqww_ASIhhscZTg.text: Looks just like their location on Elliot as far as the artwork and seating. The staff at this place seemed a bit more upbeat and courteous. I ordered a carne asada torta (Mexican sandwich) which was very good, although it was not cut in half like they usually are so it was a bit of work to get it unwrapped and cut myself since it got a bit messy. Overall the meat texture was good, not dry, and well seasoned.  I ordered a side of beans and rice which also tasted pretty good and were not too salty. The red salsa was very good and tasted homemade but the green salsa needed some work as it was bland.  My husband ordered four mini taquitos which were pretty tasty and came with onion and cilantro. I thought the cilantro was too light and had to go ask for a side but other than that it was good!  We also ordered a ceviche tostada (lime marinated shrimp) and that was very good as well! It was drenched in lime and had enough onion and spices to give it that authentic ceviche taste! Will definitely order another tostada at this location soon!

zuJLiM63MfbAmqahFWJjrA.text: this is a very good taco place. and they have other stuff besides tacos. they have burritos and quesadillas street size tacos that come in a order of 3 amongst other things. you order from the counter and they call out your number. service and staff are good too. a must try for sure.

y3vs-6vt2ag7lh0RS1YyxA.text: Love this place... really good Mexican food.. they always have posole and menudo available! Affordable and they are very helpful and fast... if you need a quick bite to eat you won't go wrong with this place. Their burritos are awesome as well...

hnnPPRjZB2nOYec6Ds5HjA.text: Delicious food, great service very clean!  Everything we tried was delicious taste like home made. Will be coming back soon to try more of the menu.

gCy2oNBrKyVBawWfRGu3ww.text: I'm so sad I had to remove this place from our rotation  of weekly take out. For some insane reason they changed their carne asada...they added some seasoning or sauce or some kind of flavor to it and it's  disgusting. I couldn't even eat it. I understand there might be those who like a barbacoa flavor but don't put that crap on my carne asada! I'm so upset.

unJJo8kbPvf1UdNZHb1KWA.text: Big fan of pastor tacos here. Good place to visit on Taco Tuesday

D-1NP62WAzV9E55JfAP8hA.text: This is a pretty good little Mexican restaurant. My friend and I ordered a variety of food including nachos, tacos, and enchiladas. They were all pretty good but our favorite was the nachos. Nice atmosphere and good service!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Asada nachos!

6hCAZZHteO0giU4SimEXGQ.text: Yesterday was my second visit and also the second time I woke up three hours after getting home with my lights and my clothes on. Let's just say the margaritas are made with love. They also have $1 street tacos with flavor. The cashiers are so nice and attentive. Come early because the line can end at the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Serious Margarita

UsnXEZAaReEuYgpniUB7eQ.text: Hands down some of my favorite carne asada tacos! Love the combo plate. Always hits the spot! The margaritas are good too. Good for a quick bite since you order & then they call your number. No wait staff.

K18Dt1K0f7bjUNkG1s1h7w.text: Its decent. The beans are great but the rice is terrible... I ate here just now.  The drinks are good and place is very clean just a decent place to eat.  not very tasty but oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. My meal

aWIsPPwynQTZ_chf5tklsA.text: Carne Asada Burrito -- excellent   Margaritas -- surprisingly good   Pico is unbelievably good!   Tacos are great as well!   Besides some order mix ups on to go orders we have been genuinely pleased with the service and food.   Always a good option for last minute dinner.

GCgKpRN5Y96vaHeYUTv1SQ.text: This is one of my go to places for a quick good meal. The food is delicious and the service has always been great as well. I have enjoyed the tacos, the pozole, as well as some of the breakfast dishes like the chilaquiles. Never disappointed with amy dish I have had so far.

SD-N3iBCCLCE9hc70_I3kw.text: This was an authentic Mexican style food resturant. A very casual appearance with an open floor plan. The atmosphere was a simple yet unique with an eye catching mural on one side of the resturant. The staff was nice and friendly.   As for the food. The carne asada is nice and flavorful. The rice and beans were average and left a little to be desired compared to the main entree. If you are into sodas this place has only the essential sodas in their fountain such as cola, lemon lime, lemonade etc but nothing special. but they do offer old fashioned glass bottles of 4 Fanta flavors.  The price is well worth the amount of food you get! Less than $10 for someone to enjoy an entree with a sodie pop and leave feeling full.   I would recommend if you want some flavorful, quick and cheap Mexican food!

w8SM1bXhe4Z1FcBcbDJk_w.text: Came here for Taco Tuesday and they had $1.30 street tacos and $1.75 flour tortilla tacos. Food was pretty good and on par with other similar taco/Mexican food places around. Prices are also pretty good overall. You really can't beat the $4 margarita specials for happy hour Monday-Saturday from 4-7pm. Margaritas themselves tasted good, but man, were they STRONG! I wasn't expecting that, but it did pair well with the tacos. Staff was very friendly and service was quick. Worth going to, but be careful with the margaritas!

vpCWLDiONNgpfAQmc_vyWg.text: This places is so delicious! I love their shrimp cocktail and ceviche tostadas. They have good street tacos as well.

jevbLcBftPjangPjybEx-A.text: Clean environment and wonderful flavorful Mexican food. Fast wait times too! Soooo good - will be back!

4Xkw4d8QY2xWEmr61mtCfA.text: The tacos are SO good. I also love their breakfast burritos. The staff is friendly & the restaurant is clean. They have great vegetarian options as well! They do a good taco Tuesday as well.

vAUsRZCzKCpnDR8DgzwBCw.text: I was quite hesitant on whether I wanted to give this restaurant a try because this specific lot is always changing out every year.   I'm glad I did give Los Taquitos a try and I truly hope they are here to stay!   Tacos were very tasty (there was one that was too spicy for my taste but still very flavorful), bright artwork to admire, and I believe I saw that their taco Tuesday special entailed $1 tacos. I definitely want to come try those out with some drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

YKgG4_YlO36LWCNTdCZ6YA.text: I've come here on multiple occasions and never necessarily had a bad experience but never great. Then today I went and the lady working the front wasn't very kind. I got a breakfast burrito and added carne Asada (which costs extra) and come to find that my burrito if mainly just potatoes and is very dry and flavorless.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

niqIJ8vgJOHqtH36C-t1Ow.text: Love love love los Taquitos!!! Higher quality food than Filibertos and so much more flavor!

vGSpWzdeyaFIXXMno0Usig.text: I live in Mesa and drive to eat here at least once a month!  I wish we lived closer I would be here once a week!! We are from Tucson originally and every time family or friends comes up from Tucson we have to take them here because they love it too!!  Everything we have ordered from the fish,shrimp,steak and even veggie street tacos to the bean burrito and quesadilla everything has been beyond good every time.  And well you wait for the food they have  two beautiful fun pieces of wall art to look at!  I highly recommend it..

ZbbFHRhhqNPP41MSHfKAhw.text: I feel like I come here every Tuesday!  Its cliche, but its for good reason. They have $1 tacos (chicken, pastor, or carnitas). They are served on corn tortillas by default, but you can opt to get the flour tortillas for the regular price of $1.75 a taco (I think).  Regardless if its Tuesday or not, this is a fantastic place. This place surpasses 95% of other taco joints without question. Its in a great location if you are getting your haircut and want food after etc. Its right by the 101.  Customer service is always fantastic. They are young, and you do have to have them repeat your order back sometimes to make sure they got the right thing (its a fast paced environment) here. The lines are always long, for good reason.  The ONLY thing I can say that needs improvement is the seating arrangements and cleanliness. Its a great thing that tons of people come here, but its PACKED around lunch time (12) and after work (6). I literally find myself racing another person trying to find a table as soon as someone gets up - so honestly one thing adds to another. The tables aren't cleaned alot, because the employees don't have enough time to clean them. Maybe integrate a table seating system like Liberty Market in Gilbert for example. They also have limited seating, but do an amazing job getting people in and out....all while still having a line to stand and order in like Los Taquitos!  Regardless, this is an amazing place. I'll forever be back - just wanted to add a tip and perhaps it'll get around to the manager or owner etc.  Food quality 5/5 Restaurant cleanliness 4/5 Customer service 4/5 Value 5/5

nO_1qRBy2YKqSmc5U6yUTA.text: All good but the yelling....  Took my wife and youngest daughter in for dinner.  Overall a positive experience, and we will return.  TLDR : Food was good, but not incredible.  Pricing was very reasonable. Bathrooms were clean.  Trash was full.  Beans and rice had unique but good flavor, and the three tacos all tasted good.  No objections.   Details :  The decor in this place is outstanding.  It looks like they were aiming to be quite a bit nicer than the average taqueria, and they succeed.   The tables are unique reclaimed wood pieces, and the chairs are fun too.  Tables were sticky.  The wall art in the place is incredible, wonderful artist.  The staff were friendly, with one staffer going the extra mile to ask me how things were and if I enjoyed the visit.    Feedback to management : The one negative about our experience, was the delivery of the food.  As each number was ready, the staffer would stand behind the counter and yell out the number.  AND I MEAN YELL!  The atmosphere in the establishment was great, but the yelling every few minutes was irritating.  Please invest in a table flag numbering system, it will really help the atmosphere.  The decor and food are right there, cutting out the need for staff to yell, should get you that fifth star!

kbYGYI_IvhwtqIdwLYdaBg.text: Came in yestarday to pick up my togo order. I ordered 2 lengua tacos with the tortilla on the side and some of there posole. The posole was absolutely amazing. Meat was vaory flavorful and savory. However i was not happy with the lengua. Normally they put onions and cilantro on top of than me but this time they put it in a bag on the side. The meat was also very tough, dry, and lacking flavor. I will say though I have been here 15 other times and the language has always been absolutely amazing. Maybe it was a different cook today I'm not sure.

UX5AxGP6deYKl5yJ8uz2SA.text: Very delicious tacos for a great price! The guacamole though... was very disappointing. It was just avocado, no tomatoes, onion, cilantro, or salt OHH but they did add the avocado seed! Definitely the boringest? guacamole I've had  not worth the $4.00.  But the tacos will definitely have me coming back! The service was great, very friendly and helpful staff. My order was placed online for  takeout and was ready in probably less than 10 minutes. Next time I will enjoy a sit in.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

wygcNfgWp8ClRiMuhtgqUA.text: Delicious delicious delicious! I had veggie burrito today and I have to say it was exactly what I was craving because it was so good and very tasty! Go try them out!

eilnUt2E6vipeLWZKnCrFg.text: This location is much cleaner and nicer than the one on Elliot & 48th. This location even smelled clean. The staff is much more friendly and welcoming too. Food is virtually the same but it was good and I got my usual. Sometimes I can't justify the prices of some of the food here and would rather go cheaper for quick Mexican food- especially at an order at the counter instead of a sit down and be served place. For what it is though they're doing everything else right & this location is the best :)

Hl7gCv5pljQa2GtirCEckw.text: Major disappointment for a vegetarians.  When I saw a specific "veggie" taco/burrito on the menu, I knew I had to try the place out. Plus the prices were so great, that what could go wrong?  I had one Veggie Street Taco and one Cheese Enchilada with verde sauce. My taco was suppose to be topped with onions, cliantro and salsa - didn't happen. The veggies consisted of onions, bell peppers and potatoes. Who puts regular potatoes in a taco?! My tortilla was dripping in oil, that I couldn't even eat it. The verde sauce on my enchilada was incredibly bland. Everything was meh to me.  Then I saw a sign for Taco Tuesday, $1 tacos! Talk about great price. BUT the real icing on the cake of this experience was that veggie tacos do not qualify for this special.   Overall, definitely won't return due to the lack of vegetarian options.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Happy Hour
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cheese enchilada with verde sauce
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie Taco

uuU_e2CQYNWUlICVjPW7xQ.text: I have been going to los taquitos for about 7 years now on 48th and Elliot.  Food is always so good and good portions.  I must say I was very disappointed with my visit to the new location in chandler.  It's down the street from me so was really excited to see it go up, but once there..... Wow they have some work to do.  Staff isn't very friendly.  My order was wrong and after reading other reviews this seams to be the trend at this location.  Some of my favorite food items are gone, but still ok considering everything I order is usually very good.  Prices are going up on items, and food portions are now getting smaller.  I ordered some asada street tacos and they were filled with mostly onion instead of meat.  $1.75 for an onion taco and a sprinkle of meat is kinda outrages.  I get it, the rent needs to be paid for new locations but don't ruin the experience for your regulars that have very gladly kept you in business for many years.  Ill try out the chandler location in a couple weeks to see if it gets any better but for now I'll keep going out of my way to the other location like I have been for years.

-vCBonAKBinNno2jGPKipw.text: On holidays and looking for something different for dinner we decided on Mexican. We opted for Los Taquitos because it was close to where we were staying and we found information online that said Guy Fieri had visited one of their sister locations with good reviews. We browsed the menu online before placing our order in the store. The lady who took our order was amazing and soooo patient. This after my going through and taking the cilantro off and adding lettuce and cheese to three out of four of the menu items I ordered. Two of the people in our party ordered burritos (shrimp and green chile pork) and the other two ordered street tacos (carnitas and asada) and between us we tried the tostadas (carnitas and asada). The shrimp burrito was good with a little bit of spice (possibly in the wrap)?, my hubby enjoyed the green chile burrito but wished it had been a tad bit spicier. I had the carnita and asada street tacos which were delicious. The asada was so tender and so savoury, I am a big fan of the carnita but this time I completely favoured the asada. The tostadas were delicious - crisp shell, beans, meat, cheese and lettuce. My mum loved the refried beans, said they were the best she has ever had, the rice equally good. Our only complaint was that the guacamole was a bit bland but the rest of the food more than made up for that. We didn't eat in the restaurant but this place had a funky casual vibe so maybe that is something to try next time!

chezOjvTpDyCTBFM87LB2Q.text: I've been here a few times recently, and the food is always excellent. It all tastes really fresh and is seasoned really nicely. The prices are very reasonable as well, so this place easily ousted Los Favoritos or Chipotle as my default burrito joints.

_SRzEim84Oi5yzWMA-AlWQ.text: They have really yummy carne asada tacos. So good. The rice and beans are just ok though.

hNFFJR1toDCQvpa84Ku2pQ.text: I have been to Los Taquitos at least 50 times.  I have frequented every location in the valley due to work travel.   I have never,  I repeat,  never been let down by the awesomeness of their food.   Don't believe the trolling of a couple people... More than likely competitors that are scared...  try it for yourself.   The street tacos are awesome but I tend to fall back on my usual,  the pollo torta (chicken sandwich).  I also get a side of rice as well as some pico to mix in with it.   It's fabulous!!

0RkcM1YpapKlcXNqNdk0tA.text: Los Taquitos has amazing food. I have had everything from tacos to burritos (regular and breakfast) to the homemade menudo and pozole. Everything is great! Great prices and even greater service. The girls who work the cashier are always willing to help you out with suggestions or even accommodate dietary/ allergy needs.

mcHvpTzYZ8FoeOyu8nY4Cg.text: Seriously love this place! We decided to stop in here for a quick bite and were very impressed. I ordered street tacos, two carne asada and one carnitas. They were seriously AMAZING. They provide two different types of salsa, red and green. Both amazing, however I enjoyed the red a wee bit more. The horchata is also very tasty and the kids meals are loaded with food. Great place to check out with cool decor.

5OHkKyEAwgwRoFGUNw3Uhg.text: Best Mexican food around!  Salsas are amazing and the breakfast burritos are to die for.  Los T is our go to take out spot.

IhwjTLhcZvg5clp8iOG1IA.text: Excellent Mexican food! It's dangerous having this new location close to home! The enchiladas, burritos, tostadas and quesadillas are all excellent. You can't go wrong!

6EMGx5iQ6XU6BGsfK2HBcA.text: Carne asada tacos are some of the best I've ever had! Beans and rice were not that great. Next time we will just get tacos. Staff was very friendly and professional.

-sxmuK3EA8pEs6Fe1FIYMw.text: I'm so glad I stopped in. I had the combo street taco plate with carne asada, fish, and pastor tacos.  They were delicious and the rice and beans were great. The portion was adequate for a normal person. The only thing lacking is a salsa bar. I will definitely return.

CdrzeDmWfvErSdq7yjiI_A.text: Food was just ok. The meat was overcooked. We stopped by for lunch on a Friday. We had to ask to have a table cleared. Waited over 15min for our order. Also a heads up, be careful of being overcharged for tacos and employees who don't care.

BPWYNmrjR0npAWN6nAjoTg.text: Came here for taco Tuesday last night and had a good meal. Chicken, pork, and one other taco were on special for 1$ a piece. I ended up having steak, fish, and pork. Pork to me was the best and had best flavor. All tacos were pretty small but good. Got chips and salsa as well.  Chips seemed to be homemade. Very good. Salsa was very much like described, more of a pico de Gallo but had good flavor.  Rice was a little plain but good. Would recommend. Very busy on Tuesdays though so call ahead if you can.

OZ1X0C2tbwepyNNbvxYzLQ.text: 4.5 Stars but giving 5 as I'd like to see this business to stay. This particular location of this strip mall has had businesses come and go too often too much. This Los Taquitos offers fresh yummy food with very reasonable price. The decor is cute and it is clean. We (4 of us) all loved our street tacos. Everything tasted fresh and clean.

q_GR9d_i3YxLOCr9ilcuHQ.text: I give it 4 months.  Slow line/ service.  Cool wall murals if your into that..  Good beans but that's all.

d9lm1cGaJ1iSfxHRozogJQ.text: Very cute decor and great tacos! I ordered the carnitas tacos (2) and they were delicious. My son ordered the Carne asana burrito and he enjoyed it. I would definitely come back again and try something else.

koOThghHn23rYfQvBxtmbQ.text: Food is OK but I have to agree with other comments, and the staff needs to focus more on customers and attention to detail. Both times I have been there they have gotten my order wrong and the people behind the counter were more interested in talking amongst themselves then focusing on their customers. There are alot of choices for GREAT Mexican food in the Phoenix area so I probably will not go back again

iDAfypHZ2B5vQpCnrFw_0A.text: Finally Los Taquitos in Chandler! Had it twice this weekend already. Carne Asada was as good as ever and the Pastor torta was excellent. I'll be grabbing the breakfast burritos on the way to work now!

yJyAcc84cE_5rB1FG2ggAA.text: Very excited to have these guys here in Chandler! Their carne is the best I've ever had! I had the carne asada bowl, excellent! Great service, great atmosphere. Already looking forward to my next trip :)

xesR1VzXsmOMol6QmSia5w.text: These tacos are the single most amazing food I have ever consumed. And the tacos aren't crap compared to there amazing burritos and quesadilla. I could eat it for breakfast lunch and dinner. But I want to stay healthy so I don't advise that. 5/5.

wifAg9SoSLziy6RTNRqptQ.text: Decent, AZ burro was pretty small, so a lot of overlapping tortilla.

hC0oVZi7euqFSMfFcRbW3Q.text: Decor is cute that's about the best thing about this place, food has no flavor, like they used no spices while cooking:( Rice and beans were so sad..and staff to focused on each other, save your money.

sFSe_Ay9d0bNI_maDXZ_gA.text: Always have the BEST tacos! Fantastic prices on Tuesday, and quality food any day of the week. We've never had street style tacos this good before. Their fillings are fresh and flavored well, and they use two corn tortillas to hold it together. Sooo yummy and will continue to recommend this place to all my friends.

w6N28PkIaawnN8fSHyKnlg.text: When we arrived and grabbed a table it was filthy- busy time, but the whole time we were there not one person came out to clean tables. We had to ask the young cashier if someone could wipe off our table. As she wiped off our table which had chunks of food on it she wiped it all onto the floor then went to the next table that had a big piece of shrimp on it and wipe the table off and everything else went to the floor.  So now everyone is walking all over rice and food it's disgusting.  Some training is in order here they are now standing behind the cash register with no one in line,  a filthy floor and several filthy tables.  Having said that our burrito was delicious.

4WAXGAtQLDZoa4Q7SyCCIg.text: I'm so glad this place was opened on 4th of July. Even with limited hours and the festivities that night, the staff attitude was so friendly and kind. Sometimes you go places on a holiday and they are not happy to be there but the staff was so nice. I love the street tacos, it's my favorite along with the chips and salsa. The price is average and the space is colorful and vibrant, very comfy and casual ambiance, yet fun! Side note: chips are so good with their green and red salsa! If you haven't been, this is a casual sit down place or a good take out option! It is old school Mexican style mixed with modern taste. I do appreciate that this place is always so clean!

5jeCiwuJHOVYPMswfRt2Uw.text: The tacos are amazing. The food is really delicious and authentic. The only thing is, the cashiers always looks like they are in a bad mood and are rude. Even though the food is excellent, the cashiers are the face of the restaurant and represent the "brand" for Los Taquitos. I used to frequent Los Taquitos often, however, now I really consider other places before going there due to the cashiers attitude.

QLEK3bp-d6BPzlUIqm9ciA.text: This place is really busy during lunch. Not sure what all of the hype is about. The place is mediocre at best.

ElwyDXpMhPyJMwXn9wQ5MA.text: I have been coming to Los Taquitos for over 16 years and love the family and the wonderful food.  Came in for Taco Tuesday and the place was pretty full. Nice to see. Ordered Chicken street tacos. The cook on the corn tortillas as well as the garnish (very fresh) for tacos were both excellent.  However, the chicken was really dry and a bit tough. A shame

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos

yUaKo_CCmb83vIGz5ByFJw.text: I was pleasantly surprised when we ate here by fluke.  I ordered a green chicken chili burrito and guacamole with chips.    Pros:  Burrito was amazing; filling and satisfying.  Price was very reasonable for all of the food you are getting.  Everything was wheelchair accessible.  Plenty of table and booth seating and inside/out seating.  Also accessible parking right in front.    I tried my husband's steak taco and couldn't believe the flavor of the steak.  It wasn't dry and it was perfectly seasoned.    Con:  Guacamole was a little thin/watery for my taste.  I prefer a little bit more salt as well and it tasted better after I added some.    Beans were not as tasteful as I had hoped; but everything else made up for it.   Even after the guacamole and beans; I would still give them a 4.5 star because of how amazing everything else tasted.

GCjeGAibL2-KSu4MF5stpQ.text: Food is bomb! Cute little cafe too with really cool art! They have lots of options! Prices are good too!  Small parking lot is the only downfall but you can always order to go and they have it ready fast

pqWjdGav0Mf7xgGlbQANXg.text: Quick and to the point.  Great service, food and environment. It has become my one a week veggie burrito joint. Other items I'm told are just as good.  I just sat down and enjoyed what I go there to get with all the condiments you want. Once finished it's time for the best jamaica in town. You be the judge, stop in and enjoy!  Peace

pvWoe0GSotAAmHD-i-8WCg.text: I have only tried the tacos (mainly on taco Tuesday) and I really like the way the meat is seasoned. Also, I am very pleased with the spice of the sauces they offer. They have a mild and one with a stronger quick. The sauce adds great complimentary flavor without overpowering the whole dish. You can always catch me here on Tuesdays!

tfEI8bzq17OcA1FCkoNk8w.text: I have been here a dozen times (at least) and love the food they serve. Smiling and helpful at the counter, and really solid tacos, burritos, tortas, and more. Their beans are legendary, and the meats inside those delectable tortillas are all smoky delicious. Salsas are also good, and the chips (though salty) are incredible.

S-aTjgrVlOeV9ceWtQswuw.text: Los Taquitos, we have a history.   I have dined LT before all the new locations, before the remodels, before they wee featured on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives with Guy Fieri.  I knew long ago they were special when I had my boyfriend pull over at the circle K because I needed more to drink because my mouth was on fire from their red salsa.  The locations and remodels are so beyond well deserved!  We wanted to get dinner tonight and I was craving Maskadores, my husband is not hooked yet so we chose our safe zone, Los Taquitos. Lucky us, it was Happy Hour! (My favorite time of day, amirite?)  We ordered 3 street tacos each, 2 kid meals, a house margarita and an IPA. BAM!  Dinner is served--- The food is flavorful, the pastor is SO yummy I regret not choosing all 3 tacos 'pastor but I decided to mix it up and order shrimp & fish also.  My only peeve of the night is they don't clarify if you want 'a la carte' or a meal. My husband and I just go for the tacos, rice & beans are extra carbs we can live without (Yea, I said it). So, $40 later, we are content, the service is great during dinner, lunch is hit or miss on service but this has been a long awaited review and I'm sure I'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

Y1w-VfI4zKbMBJpGESmsTA.text: BEST TACOs in the valley.  And their breakfast burrito is awesome as well.  Great after a good Mt bike ride.

Fcd4YlrapaOkcdTOy0YOyA.text: Service: the line was pretty fast and the service was good as well.   Food: I have only tried tacos and they are amazing!   Price: the price is reasonable for the amount of food you get.   I really recommend trying the tacos at this place!!!!

3Uc2Stl2QAKG2X1WMozCEg.text: I had the lengua, asada and el pastor tacos. I loved the lengua and asada tacos. I wasn't a fan of the sauce in the el pastor but def coming back!

Si-WtHAP8d8OLgdLFShbdA.text: Fantastic will definitely be going back to try some different things such a great place and service and food!!!

jqPNatonTepULaWsC9G7-w.text: This place is disgusting. I ordered a chicken bowl and got pieces of chicken that were still partly frozen. Tell me how this is possible? It's possible because they are taking their cooked meat and freezing it and reheating it for the following day. I am reporting this to the health department. Look out for these guys on the next episode of "dirty dining"

6r7a2aGYwdJJ3SQEJIL5cQ.text: Very well priced tacos at $1.75 a piece. I had the al pastor and carne asada tacos as well as an al pastor torta (I was hungry). I felt the carne asada was a bit saltier than I like. The al pastor was phenomenal. I'd come back for the al pastor for sure. The torta did fall apart quite a bit, but it was tasty.  It's also a very clean, nice place to sit down and eat. Very open feel.

69xVGqjRjz5nflYYXwf5dw.text: I just tried this place for the first time this week. The food was ok, I got the enchiladas, they weren't anything special so I wouldn't get them again. My friend got their asada tacos and they looked good. The reason for the 1 star is because they altered my receipt, giving themselves an additional tip. I know what I signed for and it cleared for more than I authorized. More of a heads up than a review, keep an eye on your receipts!

P3Z_i8ZXOJgEJPVqH4kyNQ.text: Love street tacos with lengua!! I fell in love with the wall murals at first sight is another reason to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wall mural decoration
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. 3 street tacos with shrimp and 3 with lengua

vxiZ6bzI2eNv7XpS8INouA.text: Went there on Sunday @ 5:30 pm. And they were out of a few menu items, Disappointing, so we went back on Tuesday and I had a green chile bowl. Good flavor but the meat was very fatty. Daughter had a chile relleno plate & liked it. Great customer service & cold beer.

mhh2XFTxXaYv7U-r5Jqj6w.text: Great tacos! I had the combo plate with shrimp, beef and a pork taco all recommended by the server, they didn't disappoint. I also loved the picked carrots that they served!

un5SsRJgFx9zIEFE2a_5Lw.text: I'm from LA and this joint has the best "street taco" al pastor tacos. And they're only $1 on tuesdays Plus, the staff is cool.

G0CdRcH21gKzPZqNatDeeA.text: My favorite mexican restaurant in the valley! I've been going to their Awatukee location for years, right after Diners, Drive-in and Dives featured it in an episode. I even drive to their 16st & Glendale location when in that area. If you like fresh, authentic mexican food, without a  mountain of sour cream, shredded iceberg and yellow cheese on top, you will also love their food.  I've pretty much tried everything. My favorite is the carnitas torta. The carnitas are not greasy,  they have a distinct flavor, with a hint of cinnamon. The bread is slightly sweet and just the right bite to it. Of the two salsas, the red one is my favorite. I wish they would bottle it for sale. Their chile rellenos are unique with really good cheese and chunks of potatoes with a flavorful but not spicy red sauce on top. Did I mentioned their margaritas? They are fantastic! Strong, good quality, without that after taste found in a lot of other places. My husband, the health nut, ultramarathoner  loves their trainer salad and bean burritos. On another note, I keep asking the cashiers, to ask the owners where they get their playlist music. I'm originally from Latin America and just love their selection of latin music.

OOxv1hWvhXB6fTkcD4BohA.text: My 15 yr old insisted this was a good place to check out for authentic Mexican food. I will admit I was impressed. Got the pollo bowl and it was better than Chipotle and I don't find many places better than Chipotle.

ttBXLbRmdLBc43s8aD2F8g.text: Was excited to see this restaurant opened a new location close to my house. Came in for happy hour around 5:30pm on a Friday. Not too many people in the place. We ordered 2 house margaritas, shrimp bowl, chips n salsa, and 3 street taco plate. Took almost 20 min to get our food and they forgot our margaritas. So we got those after our food. Food was good but nothing to write home about. I think the prices are a little high for the amount you get. There also needs to be a sign that says where the line begins because there was a lot of confusion amongst costumers of where to go to order. I definitely think the location on Elliott is better but I hope this new location gets better with time.

aU1IQv9p6Ghql20oGEZuaw.text: Tuesdays are bomb af. Carnitas tacos are life and the nachos are not shabby! Love love love the red salsa and basically can't wait till next Tuesday!

dSd-9X1IFK5rXJMin0lV4g.text: Awesome family run business! Amazing, fresh & authentic Mexican cuisine. We have been "regular's" for 12+ years! Huevos Rancheros is legit!! Shrimp burrito is another fav!!

atlHa_3gD3Bs1Rgr5sZ62g.text: This place is very good . I would recommend it to anyone . Love the green sauce enchiladas and the carne asada tacos .

5Xv0v8eu8ObznK12F3Yeng.text: Decor  is great.  Lighting nice.  Food prices very reasonable.  Food was great.  Good tasting.  Comfy.

b244FeCPSy9yy_nZXW7dsg.text: I had very low expectations only because the Qdoba that previously was located here gave me a bad taste in my mouth. But I gave it a shot. I had the steak bowl Arizona style. The steak was delicious and there was lots of it. Look out chipotle king of the meat skimping. I took my order to go wait was only about 5 min. Food was hot when I got it home I live about 3 miles away. All in all give it a shot it's about the same price as chipotle but there isn't a line out the door.. yet. Check it out!

NJBOQAcZ57qToxN0aI4E6w.text: I've been here several times since they opened this location. I love everything here! Tasty carne asada tacos, bean tosadas, al pastor, menudo, chips with pico salsa and guacamole. The food is truly authentic and taste homemade. Felt like I'd find my nana and tio in their kitchen. My new favorite spot for Mexican food.

gE9okB35V7wVbuRU-1rNoA.text: Loud, over spiced and unfriendly.  Grissly asada.  Not impressed.  First and last time

rXnioGpfNeMnxBWT6qYjfw.text: I'm from out of town and was literally expecting a taquito bar. Kinda misleading! There are no taquitos on the menu, but the menu is fresh and easy! I had tacos. The fish tacos aren't battered like every where else. The carne asada tacos were perfect. They do serve alcohol which is awesome. One other downside, is that parking there is a pain the the butt!

qM1m7xMVuRbML72BAw3Nqw.text: Came here for the first time tonight. We ordered the carne asada taco meal, super nacho's, a kids meal chicken taco, a cheese quesadilla, and chips with salsa. Everything was great my daughter enjoyed her kids meal and the price was right for the amount of food she received. The taco meal was very filling and the green salsa was really good. I would for sure return here for taco Tuesday or a margarita. The girl behind the counter was very friendly polite. Love the decor and the seating was very open.

7jv9YWR-N0I8thLHGjczRg.text: Great location, awesome decor, and the food consistently is outstanding!!! Keep up the good work!!!

MKqZQl-JA9XltIINNtohbw.text: My favorite!  I love the steak tacos and steak quesadilla with a Mexican Coke.  Nice location.

hzNNkgQXJeNJ_Z4W26T26A.text: Yeeeeessss supreme burrito was perfect and the atmosphere is really cool. Super quick service

tuajyhMKoQkWw0fksMKIXg.text: First time, it was very delicious! Love the street tacos (asada and carnitas) decoration is great

yjzLyDZE2yqltXs4QT6VhA.text: The tacos are good, not great. The salsas aren't very flavorful. The biggest issue would be the tiny amount of chips you get with chips and salsa or guacamole. Pathetic. They were pricy too for the tiny portions. It's a nice environment though.

pf2ff8SfOQT0HygF3WMrpg.text: Wow! This is a great spot for authentic Mexican food. We had the bean tostada, green cheese enchilada, and veggie bowl. It was all amazing!!!

SyFmeb-g7hcLw6uT3p6anw.text: I was really surprised on how delicious the tacos are from this place! My favorite option from the tacos would have to be the pastor. The two salsas that was available at the time (green & red) was also pretty good and I noticed the green was spicier.   All in all the restaurant is nice and clean with pretty speedy service. The tacos does indeed have that authentic street style like taste. I love the fact that you can order alcoholic drinks here so that's a plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pastor, Lengua, Carnitas Street Tacos

G5DLZLAh8VQGklD4lMLQNA.text: So I eat at the Los Taquitos in Ahwatukee but this is the first time I've eaten at this one. Let's just say I'll be sticking to the one closer to home from now on. I don't eat beef or chicken so I only eat Seafood needless to say however our initial reason for coming to this side of town was to eat at Hash Kitchen but being that it's Sunday the wait is 1:30 min so we came next door.   My daughter and I eat at many different places. It's our way to try new places new food and just hang together   Let's just say she wasn't impressed either.    I get the same thing every Taquitos visit and the shrimp tacos were very sad. They place 3 small shrimps in a taco so it's not really a taco but an appetizer. They might as well just hand you the shrimp in a bowl. The Ahwatukee Taquitos puts at least 7, its a real taco. The food is still good but their presentation is horrible.   The people also working in Ahwatukee are a lot much happier. Not sure if the two times I've been in being the first was for my son but they seem very tired and unhappy to greet.   The food is fabulous at either but let just say if you want quantity visit the Ahwatukee location and see the difference.

36sMmAgkq0cWfGF_uXzfEg.text: Just went in for Taco Tuesday got 5 chicken Tacos 5 Carnitas to go. I'm home eating a Carnita Taco and I  bite down on something hard split it out and spit again. So in 1 bite these 2 bones came out.  Why in the carnita taco?  The chicken and carnitas taste the same just different color.  They have a strange flavor. The cashier goes back and forth from cashiering to cooking.  I'm really disappointed. I wanted to like this place. Maybe the cashier should stay taking orders. Scary.  Be careful. I am posing photos.

Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cute pink chair
