1erl8IE5gzlzj6UUIrB9PQ.text: This is a nice little establishment! Loved the interior decorating here- casual, laid back & fun. Beautiful painted murals on the walls really liven the place up! The rustic tables are fun with all the mismatched chairs. And the menu is large, center & easy to navigate. Best part: VERY affordable & a great selection, including margaritas! (Although, that is frowned upon during lunch hour w/ the boss, LOL!)   Co-workers are all obsessed w/ the street tacos, and they looked really good! I ordered the chili rilleno combo. And was a little disappointed it took twice as long for that... didn't get my food until almost everyone else had gotten their taco combos & finished. But, I appreciated that it was made fresh! And it was good. Not the best I've had, but not bad at all. It wasn't overly breaded, but there really wasn't a lot of cheese. So the flavor was lacking. Same with the rice & beans- there wasn't a lot of flavor, but still a good meal & not bad for around $10 total w/ a drink.   I'd definitely like to come back and try the tacos. And the portion sizes are plentiful for the cost! Generous servings, and mine came w/ flour or corn tortillas on the side. The homemade salsas are also pretty good- had to snag a couple to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chili rilleno w/ rice, beans, flour tortilla &amp; red/green salsas
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

aEL-4p_xdfoH9W5skxqSpg.text: Come here only for the menudo. The menudo here is solid- nice slightly viscous, spicy broth. Not too much hominy, plenty of spoon sized bites of tripe. Comes with a portion cup of chopped onion and cilantro and tortillas.  The portion itself is a shareable size. If placing a to go order the serving(s) comes in a 32 oz to go cup. For $6.xx it's a great deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

-2ubCoPMqhzsgD-T0CEyDQ.text: Aewsome great place for tacos and more..... Will be back !!! Highly recommended tell your friends.

HyFCuNemLaFor7nnfvUp7A.text: Prologue: My fiancee and I were out running errands, as usual, when she mentioned that she was in the mood for some Mexican food. We stopped by for lunch in the early afternoon on a weekday.  The Plot: We started out by sharing a Breakfast Burrito with Pollo and a Carnitas Torta, which was followed by a bowl of Menudo.  The Scene: The restaurant was clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. The service was prompt and courteous.  All of the items we ordered were as appetizing as they look (see photos below) and the portion sizes for both were plenty for the two of us.  The Breakfast Burrito included a generous amount of all of the ingredients. The chicken was tender and juicy and the eggs and potatoes were also moist and tender.  The Carnitas Torta was especially generous in size. The shredded pork was tender, nicely seasoned, very flavorful, and I particularly liked the sauce.  The bowl of Menudo was plenty for the two of us and the level of spice was just right.  The Rest of the Story: This restaurant is a little pricey compared to a typical taqueria franchise but the quality is worth it. Some of the pieces of tripe in the Menudo were rather large and still somewhat rubbery, but it was still yummy.  Epilogue: My fiancee decided that she would like to stop in for lunch more often.  Photo Design By: Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Los Taquitos
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Los Taquitos
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burrito with Pollo

88D2dHv6JboCr3QdequCfQ.text: One Taquito, two Taquitos, LOS Taquitos, four! That's right, you can't just eat one. You have to eat at least two!  To tell the truth we actually don't come here for taquitos, we come here for street tacos! Now that I think of it, I don't think I have ever seen a taquito on their menu. Go figure!  Their street tacos are so tasty and they don't hurt the pocket. At about $1.75 per taco you really can't go wrong! My favorite is the carne asada and my brother likes pastor.  The only taco I wasn't partial to was the lengua. The quesadillas are great too, they run about $4.90, but if you order from the kid's menu you can snag one for $4.00.  I don't think there is an item over $9.00 on their menu. They are so reasonable when it comes to their prices!  The biggest gripe I have about this place is the parking, which really isn't within their control.  Parking is a nightmare here during weekend brunch hours due to their neighbors to the east. Just be ready to take a walk from the other side of the parking lot when you visit Los Taquitos. Unless you are lucky enough to catch someone as they are leaving, you will be better off biting the bullet and taking a leisurely stroll from the parking lot to the west.   So if you find yourself low on cash and big on hunger, take yourself over to our favorite little taco shop right off of Price Road in Chandler! They will hook you up!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne Asada Tacos
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dia de los Muertos Mural

uuIEjvhE-vpKFM8gr4PCKg.text: Oh my G*d!  The food here is incredible.  And now for the rest of the story...  Ever since Burger 21 closed eighteen months ago, our little group of co-workers have been coming here. That is, when we are not at Juan Jaime's that is. LOL  Los Taquitos is an order your food and drink, call out your number type place. But is it by no means a low rent, Chipotle wannabe. They serve great tasting Street Tacos, Carne Asada Bowl (photo) and yes, they even make a mean Margarita.  Their Top Shelf one is only $7.00 btw. Nice!  The only drawback so far has been their occasional order goofs. Now don't get me wrong, they are really, really, really very sweet, hard working and super friendly, which more then makes up for this short coming.   But there is some "failure to communicate", which we decided to just ignore at this point. So if it happens to you, just go with the flow. Do as I do, just consider it as an opportunity to taste another one of their dishes .  As I said, everything is delicious, as the line around noon time will surely indicate.  Tuesday is Taco Day, so bring your appetite for their Street Tacos (photos)which are only $1.39 each.  Nice!  Expect to pay $10 or so, depending on how thirty or hungry you are.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

fr8YsN1opWZXbqosCmdyEQ.text: We chose to go to this place for a Friday lunch and it was packed. Though ordering didn't take long, the food to arrive took some time. One has to order and wait for the food then pick it once the number is called. The walls of the restaurant has beautiful Mexican art and looks very captivating. I went with street tacos with rice and beans. I ordered carnitas, fish, shrimp and chicken tacos. The food arrived looking colorful. The tacos were very tasty and the ingredients used were fresh. I loved everything about the tacos, however the fish tacos my least favourite and so was the rice & beans. The best was the carnitas, it was juicy and really good.  I love spicy food, that being said, the downside was the spice level, all the tacos had a little more than required spice in them.   I loved the food here. The price is decent and costed me $9.50, overall a very good place for tacos.

wD9pJ6bL6ixPC4GAo7Vv7w.text: Heard about this place on Diners Drive In. Came to check it out with the family. Definitely not a sit down and take your order kind of place. I ordered the chili relleno combo, my husband ordered street tacos and a carne asada quesadilla. Tacos were great! Had a bite of the chicken with the green sauce.. pretty yummy! My son just had side of chips and their refried beans.  Rice was good but the beans and chili relleno was just ok. Poured the red sauce all over to give it better flavor. Red sauce is delicious! I would definitely be back and just order tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carne asada quesadilla and street tacos ( Pollo, carnitas, and pastor)

vGt1Ev9-jjeBNSG5Cvu-Lg.text: Great food, love their menudo! Their carne asada tacos and ceviche are pretty bomb as well. Their Trainer Salad used to be my favorite but they started adding potato. It was a surprise change, IMO, and getting a mushy mess traumatized me. (I asked for it w/out potato the next time- but the damage was done and I got flashbacks lololol. I don't think I'm getting it again). Also their tortillas for the menudo taste weird (gross even) but the tortillas they use for tacos are yummy.

UXHtW0JdLBmpCsbPdeN2Hw.text: The best way to experience a culture is through their food!!!   That being said, being married to a Spanish man we decided to bring my mother-in-law here when she was craving Menudo before she flew back home!   We placed our order over the phone and was able to pick up immediately. The inside of the restaurant was very clean, open and very comfortable! The girls in the front were very happy, greeted us and made sure our questions were answered.  We all had the menudo soup! It was sooo delicious! This was my second time and my husbands 4th I believe. I love the fact that they had authentic condiments which included red onions, cilantro, lime, some oregano, and chili powder. This particular soup is an acquired taste, so if you are open to yummy slow cooked tripe then so for it!! Make it your own dish and add whatever u need! If you grew up with menudo, this will bring you back to grandma/moms home cooking!   For all 3 giant cups of soup we paid $19.00 and some change! Not including the tip.   They do have some other dishes! So if you have time go check them out! We will continue to explore more off their menu when we return!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

Z73JyaYqKqlwEWtH1CqFMw.text: Sometimes the first thing I think of when I wake up is... Is it Taco Tuesday?!   On days when it is, I often hit up Los Taquitos! $1 for pretty damn good street tacos? Can't go wrong.  It's usually pretty packed on Tuesdays but the flavor/value is spot on so it's not a surprise.  On non-Tuesdays I've ordered other menu items like their carne Asada torta which I've always enjoyed and devoured quickly. Burritos are a hit or miss for me here, sometimes they're big and well portioned and sometimes it'll be on the skinnier, skimpier side. Service is typically friendly and energetic.   In a plaza that has some everchanging food spots, they have been around for a while now, just doing it up right with some good flavors and consistency!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tacooooos

EFW6GRtdWBFuSyWYyeex-g.text: For some reason the original location still does it best but this restaurant is amazing and the food is so flavorful. The green salsa is too die for and it's a really chill environment and fast service. Much higher quality than many quick service Mexican restaurants around town. The parking situation is limited especially on Saturdays or Sundays.

DEckRoUYymQidNrw0nfkTw.text: Wow this place is great! We were in the area and it was still pretty early. We arrived at 10:30am and surprisingly there were people already dining in.  The cashier greeted us while we were looking over the menu but she had some attitude going on.. I was split between ordering the menudo and the posole, and she recommended I go with the posole.   We ordered one large posole (comes with your choice of tortilla) two chicken tacos, and one carne asada bowl.   The dining area is pretty big and they have seating outside as well. They yelled out our number and we went to pick up our food. Everything looked and smelled delicious!   The posole was pretty good! I added the toppings they provided and it was amazing. (Cilantro, cabbage, onion) The chicken tacos were so freakin good! The chicken was well seasoned and not at all dry. You do have the option of getting the tacos with everything on top or to just get your tacos plain. I got mine with everything on top. (Salsa, onion, cilantro)   My friend ordered the carne asada bowl and was surprised as too all the meat they had put in it. She did say though, she wishes they hadn't put so much pico de gallo and beans in it, and it needed more rice.   The inside was clean and the wall art is great to look at. The music was "LIT" and at times it got kinda hard to hear my friend.   Great food and they also have alcoholic drinks!

Ex0JiJ8iwbQmfyGf2vHJxw.text: It's edible...   Rice 1-10 / 5 Beans 1-10 / 7  Tacos 1-10 / 6 tortillas under cooked   This is the 2nd location I tried and I'll tell you this I won't be back .

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

aAe-7zyIpU3HHEQ9JksNhQ.text: This place is like a hidden gem. I would've never knew this place existed if it wasn't for one of the doctors I work with. Good thing he shared this awesome place with us at our office because everything so far that I have tried here has been amazing. I enjoyed their shrimp tacos and their shrimp cocktail was on point. If you are looking for some flavorful Mexican food this place is one you need to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Shrimp Cocktail

YO4BVDxo228V0ctDmQ92HA.text: Really delicious street style tacos that will make your taste buds write you a thoughtful thank you letter and send it in the real mail with a real stamp, not just some quick email.  I came here with some local customers of mine who chose it as a great lunch spot. It's not expensive, so it's a good sign that a place is great when someone picks it even though they aren't buying. It's the kind of place you want to just share with people.  You can get 3 tacos with rice and beans for a little over 7 bucks. If your feeling like a glutton, you can get additional tacos for $1.75. I couldn't narrow it down past 4, so I went with gluttony. Don't judge me.  Heres the final verdict: Carnitas and Al Pastor were both fantastic. Not greasy, full of flavor and cooked beautifully. If I lived here, it might be hard to keep me from camping in front of this place. The carne asada was very good as well. The Pollo was good, but a little flat compared to the others. Its probably way better than I give it credit for, but its hard when you are a farm team star playing on a big league field. I do have to say, the guacamole side was also a little plain. I would expect more from a place where the tacos pack in so much flavor.  Service was super friendly. It's an order at the counter place, and inside is casual, comfortable and clean.   A real winner. Now, go eat some tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Behold the glory! Al pastor, Pollo, Carne asada, Carnitas. The 4 horsemen of the good flavor apocalypse!
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Guacamole and chips side order. This comes with twice as many chips

7tsHsACRWb-0u3LO7IRdiA.text: As a self-proclaimed connoisseur of all things delicious, I felt obliged to let others know about this place...First of all...can you say CARNITAS?! YUM!! Cooked to mouth watering perfection!   We live all the way over in Goodyear and would make the traffic-filled trip out there again, without question. Inexpensive, authentic food, fun atmosphere (with super-cool Day of the Dead murals), great service. Highly recommended!

IX-yVhUAoZm3i3wB6RVYNA.text: Love the atmosphere!!! The street tacos & tortas are to die for!! We've been back 3 times

09LpFMOscLK-xz9Uw-uGsw.text: A must for Taco Tuesday's. Also if you love menudo or posole. Both are delicious here. Been there many times and it always hits the spot.

cuWsXiVjJ_VUqPiwKJ4Uow.text: I am Originally from LA where Mexican food is the best!! street tacos and taco trucks in every corner and the bets places are the hole in the wall. When I first saw this place I thought it was going to be another Americanized place offering overpriced bland food. Little did I know this place is a must!!  The food is tasty, they also have a variety of alcoholic beverages you could choose from. I wish they had super spicy salsa. But most places don't. I've had the tacos, which I love that they're small and not full of sour cream and cheese. They're are almost like street tacos which I love!  I've also had the ceviche which I must say is better than some of the seafood places I've tried out here.  I also like that they have different salsas to be used in the front. The wait is pretty long. I usually go for my lunch and I spent most of it waiting for my order.  The staff there is extremely friendly and the artwork is awesome.  I cant wait to try their Pozole yummy!

4NzDZeC61gXzEBjgKLCEgg.text: Just left here and I was so impressed I just had to write a review. First their prices are beyond reasonable. I had a blood orange margarita that was excellent. Not too sweet,  not too sour, it was perfect. Chilaquiles was so good. Everything tastes like Nana made it.  Horchata came out of a big agua fresca container dished out with a ladle like it should be. Place is legit. $1 taco tues! Clean and super cute dia de los muertos style decor. Love this place! This will be our new fave for sure.

lLQXFvXwUXXth5KCOR1x2A.text: My family and I went last night for dinner-- the house margarita was small but awesome. The food was adequate but not impressive.

QmCXNvDrm35ouCEh5DycPw.text: I was very excited when this place opened because many fellow Yelpers stated that their food was so good at the other locations.  In fact, a few Yelpers were so excited that they posted positive reviews of this place before the restaurant opened- not cool!  This review is based on the three times I have been there.  The first time I went I ordered the pastor taco, shrimp taco and a chicken enchilada.  While the tacos were flavorful and not too spicy, the chicken enchilada was kind of a mess.  The entire enchilada needed to be cooked more.  On the second occasion, I had the Super Nachos.  There was nothing super about the Super Nachos except I had a super stomachache after I ate them.  I returned today and decided to go with the tacos again.  As today was Taco Tuesday, Los Taquitos was offering chicken, carnitas and el pastor tacos for just $1.00 a taco.  The chicken taco I ordered was very tasty but the two other tacos were actually kind of nasty.  Today the el pastor taco was incredibly spicy while the other day it was mild..  Consistency is important and hopefully Los Taquitos will figure it out.  It also would be nice if they had more salsas available or some sort of salsa bar to liven the tacos up.

3DyghdRNNI-bb-NWuP2oKQ.text: Everyone is super friendly.  The food is awesome and the green salsa satisfies my cravings for spicy without making me cry like the wimp i am. I will definitely be back

12l_IEhzvPZjkdB949yGkQ.text: Just as good as the Ahwatukee location. Very nice staff, very clean. I had the pollo flautas with rice and beans. Perfect and delicious.  I only wish they would offer a small side of pico with the meal (even for a little more $) so that I didn't have to pay $2.50 for a large side of pico that is too much in quantity.

UszNIpZSi1Qsn0RpA8oT5w.text: This place is Awesome. Always a friendly smile to take your order. The food is so good and authentic. Great prices too. Wish there were more locations.

k-LEvNvf9fii500VtSAkuA.text: I was excited to see Los Taquitos basically in my backyard. I have tried both the grilled fish and al pastor burritos. The grilled fish has good flavor, but was slightly too dry in my opinion. I had to add extra salsa. The al pastor on the other hand was delicious: well-marinated and perfectly cooked. On one occasion, my rice was undercooked. The portions are smaller than most divey, Mexican fast food restaurants. Overall, Los Taquitos is a good choice: not amazing, not bad.

F3Rjhs8x0o1p0GKyHQ3jew.text: First time here.  Was excited because it's less than 1 mile from my house but not at the top of my favorite Mexican restaurants.  I ordered the shrimp burrito because the only fish they offer is tilapia.  Beware, it's spicy!  I don't mind spicy but for those of you who do...  Wasn't crazy about the dressing they used for the burrito.  Rice was nothing special, especially since I found a piece of paper in it.  Retried beans were good.  The place wasn't packed and I thought the wait was longer than normal.

ihrODWEnB90s7dZFNBGauw.text: Just average quality food. I got three carne asada tacos with rice/beans. Tacos were tiny! I was hungry 2 hours later.  I won't return.

vIbahLj1tOBm6icsXAy6wA.text: Ask for chips right away. Food is great and they serve alcohol! However, it takes a long time to get fresh food so order some chips and salsa ( they don't come with the food). They also won't give them to you in advance of your order, so you have to ask. That way you have something to snack on while you wait.

sdvkTVjoyLh2mak9VSMkcA.text: I've driven by this place everyday for a month waiting for this location to open. Food was just as delicious as the other locations (fish tacos, carnitas taco, carne asada tostada).

sQKQ9dpBG9IBdBfqgix5RA.text: Pretty good tacos. The salsas werent very impressive or flavorful. The amount of chips you get with salsa or guac is pitiful. Especially considering the cost. The guacamole doesn't taste all too different then blended avocado. Very little flavor.

-3gMLpxvpG3MbRizvdr-MQ.text: First time here,very clean, staff was really nice, but didn't know what to order. The girl recommended veggie tacos. I wouldn't have ordered those on my own but her description sounded really good! They were amazing! I'm a meat kinda girl bit would definitely order the veggie tacos again! My daughter got the carnitas tacos which were amazing too! Will definitely recommend and come back again!

2zgCsSLmNssYW_dbZMSh0Q.text: Two words, Taco Tuesday!  $1 tacos can't be beat!  Oh and did I say they are also very delicious tacos?!  Because they really are amazing!  Taco Tuesday $1 tacos are chicken (my fav), carnitas and pastor. I also recommend the carne asada and the fish tacos. The prickly pear margarita is also very good!

OAiyVDSwUHtUW2kyPvjP9w.text: Taquitos aren't even on the menu! I was told they are discontinuing them but they made them anyway. Overpriced and not very good. Service was slow...Not a good first impression.  Probably won't be back.

ECJgKKiwtuSQWH1FVqqcIA.text: 30 minutes for rice and beans?  And to be rewarded with average food with rotten pico de gallo?  Free is too expensive.  Do not bother with this place.

WsDeRPM_xdyZ353QjWCg1A.text: Love this place !! Great customer service always greets you with a smile no matter how busy or slow it is !! Best veggie taco by far and rice beans are sooo good ! Love that they use the white cheese instead of yellow for quesadillas and everything else great atmosphere and food all around!! I come here at least once or twice a week always consistent!

RMdWQgHIw9IM06qEi7KVfA.text: I ordered 3 tacos; carnitas, fish and Al pastor. The carnitas was a little too wet, making for a soggy taco. The fish is grilled, not fried. (I prefer fried myself, but it was still damn good) The Al Pastor was probably the best I've ever had

sQMus3I1Xb8Haz1ndzF4Bg.text: The breakast burritos are the best thing on the menu.  Don't try to order one on Tuesday though - they only serve tacos on  Tuesdays.    Irritating.  The tacos are good but not as good as their reputation.  Guacamole is great.  Nothing is cheap and the service is marginal.  Just doesn't live up to the hype.  There are better places for fast casual Mexican food.

Hf2p2pKdjmO_W_TIvgpwnA.text: Amazing and delicious food. Probably one of the best Mexican food spots in the valley. The tacos definitely taste like the street tacos I used to get in LA. Great house margaritas. Very decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

jEU9I0ES0x9RgKvfcfeHhA.text: So excited to have Los Taquitos in Chandler! I had my usual Carnitas burrito and their steet tacos. Both taste just like I remember from Ahwatukee. Ran into one of the sisters today too! They are so friendly and really appreciate their customers. The place was clean, and the staff was very friendly as well. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed. Ask for the habanero sauce if you dare! $1 street tacos on Taco Tuesday, I'd start with 8.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Carnitas Burrito, no beans. Phenomenal, try this!

5gaxHT8VgXnx-lR75zeEog.text: My favorite carne asada streets tacos in Arizona .  So great I eat there every Tuesday . Yep taco Tuesday .

OF-gVdVYhMd5zpjWgd8zTw.text: Great taco spot! The flavors are incredible. We tried their margaritas for the 1st time. Trust me, you only need one lol. Careful coming on a Tuesday though. It's gets so busy and the wait is kinda long and they run out of a lot of stuff. So get there early. The staff is awesome. Definitely a must try

kwjXrucl7Bv7BdLUaExcyQ.text: Delicious street tacos. $1 Taco Tuesday special. Clean and bright modern space with great murals on the walls.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

-EjXJz8AtfQfyufCIAldSw.text: Taco Tuesday was a great decision. The carnitas and carne asada were both excellent.  I did not care for the chicken. The veggie bowl is surprisingly delicious... I loved the potatoes. If you want a healthy and tasty quick casual alternative to Chipotle, with a much better selection, this is your place.

pGte2XdQZ47QdYwJXJ_v8w.text: The lemonade tasted musty so I switched to the tea which was also wonky. My husband said the bowl he ordered was flavorless. My tacos were okay but not great. This is the second time we've been here and not enjoyed it. I'm not sure what we are missing that everyone else likes.

sh7q5sqGqX5iPl1qLxAoqw.text: This was my first time visit at the Chandler location. They are every bit as good as the Ahwatukee location. I got my standard carne asada burrito Arizona style. Fantastic!!! The salsa was awesome! They need to bottle it and sell it. This is a 5-star review.

P8FXviIaZZ2IyAZb1agJJg.text: This food is amazing. Taste so good!! Always my top spot to eat when I'm near chandler.

E5P2YgWkQ1u0HE2bjijfKQ.text: This place is great. I love the Menudo. The last time I was here, I had to ask what was going on with my food 3 different times. Don't F it up for me Los Taquitos!!! I can't end up back at Taco Bell.

CCfT-hq-BoCu-jzkaG0Q9g.text: This is my favorite Taco Tuesday spot. Tacos are $1.00 and the special includes Al Pastor, Chicken and Carne. Tacos are a regular street taco size and they come with onions and cilantro. Their green and red salsa are both very flavorful. Staff is super friendly and they do a great job of keeping the place clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken and Al Pastor tacos.

q1z88NFpZsr66yNGfIB7bw.text: What can I say...I showed up as a first timer for a taco Tuesday to-go order. I just finished eating the tacos and they were good enough for me to pull my phone out, post-meal, and write up a Yelp review to express my satisfaction. The pastor tacos were delicious and the carnitas tacos were also a delight. Both the red and green salsa were very tasteful. I hope to be back soon!

WuhwvZcep0LvncXjg7qL1Q.text: Happenin' little place - cool mural, simple menu, lots of smiling faces and some pretty tasty food.  Can't beat tacos for a buck on Tuesday!  Not really ideal for solo take-out, end up twiddling your thumbs for 15 minutes.  Margaritas next time!

_l2dyzQfOSKoac3CKCqZFQ.text: Food is Always very Tasty.  I highly recommend you eat any item on the menu.  I especially enjoy the Ceviche.   Breakfast Burritos are just good. It could have been better.   Chicken Torta is Delicious the Bread is very crunchy with a soft center and subtly sweet.  The place is clean. I did not use the restroom so I cannot give a feedback on it.   Kids Cheese quesadilla was very greasy and a bit salty. The rice are a bit bland.  Customer service MUST be improved.   Overall 3 stars . Could have been 5 stars.

a_D_2iboyEvi5G9ZWGNstA.text: Not very flavorful. Tacos were decent, but pretty bland. Chile relleno was disgusting, it had cubed potatoes inside. My Mexican-American wife was disappointed with everything.   Margaritas were mediocre.  Honestly the food at El Rancho market is better.

6NXzraPsEkkDMLewXMMdqA.text: Best street tacos and burritos !!!!  You will not be dissapointed !! Best resturant enviornment where ive had street tacos

Mf6aOpIah4Z-0y7qM7fxmw.text: Fresh: -pico -ceviche  -enchilada sauce -jalapenos  ...and service.  Hope this place is here to stay for the neighborhood.

ryIQJ4OEq8yjykQeBfq2JQ.text: My husband and I usually come here for taco Tuesday and have always had good, but decided to come for dinner on a Sunday evening andget burritos.  We both ordered chicken burritos and I added enchilada style.  Unfortunately the chicken was extremely dry and very very salty.  My burrito did not come with salsa or beans inside like the menu states.  My husband ordered his Arizona style with the pico on the side.  Again just a bunch of dry chicken with potato's and no pico.  The order took particularly long too and our cashier had a massive hickey on the right side of her neck with bite marks that she didn't even attempt to cover up.  Classy!   I'll be back for taco Tuesday again, but that's about it.

F0v9jwxlOEPCVLYRB7a12w.text: If you're looking at Los Taquitos for lunch or dinner, I HIGHLY suggest the one on Elliot over this location. I go at least 4x a month for over 2 years to Los Taquitos on Elliot & have never had an issue with my food or the staff. Today, I decided to try the one on Ray Rd, since it was closer to my meeting. Wrong decision. Upon order, the lady at the front was rude she legit stares at you without saying one word - she expects you to read her mind. This resulted in having a problem with my food.. I had nothing put purple stuff all over my tacos (cabbage). It was as if I ordered cabbage with a little bit of taco. When bringing it to the front I stood in line for about 5-10 minutes before being helped, listening to the same lady who "helped me" "helping another person" - all she kept doing was repeating everything in the burrito bowl to the customer, when the customers question was "is it all grilled together in the bowl", repeating what's in it won't answer if it's grilled together, but again the lady behind the counter expects you to read her mind. I was informed that they do not put lettuce and pico on the street tacos anymore... like street tacos w/o lettuce & pico. When advising another lady she said, they haven't updated the signs but it's been like this for months. Since when? What? When I advised her I never had this issue at the one on Elliot, her demeanor changed quickly trying to be nice. The staff was very unprofessional & not helpful at all. Also included is a picture of my shrimp... tell me you'd wanna eat this & maybe I'll change my views on this location. When I decide to go back, I'll be sticking to the nice ppl on Elliot. I think maybe Guy needs to come back and evaluate his rating on this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

iGWWrjd_HGS87eXvL8yRWw.text: Tucked away in a corner in a small strip, your  typical glass enclosed fast food resto, Los Taquitos offers street tacos. We ordered 2 asada, 2 carnitas, 1 pastor, 1 fish, all street tacos. With drinks, 1 rice n beans, flan, it came to $22.Flavor was average; the sauce tasted the same for all the tacos. The carnitas had a lime flavor instead of the asada which threw me off as I'm used to having lime only with asada tacos. The meat were all soft n juicy. The flan was bland and the texture led me to believe it didn't have enough egg yolks - but it was obviously healthier for you. The asada is worth another try but that's it.

zGeV47w6SOxasqRWmw1-fw.text: Had tacos, chips and salsa.  Salsa is peco not salsa.  Meat did not have any flavor.  Tortillas were mealy, not good.

zmH_YsR5fsWsCvXzAlB0xQ.text: Very good food and service. The two areas I would encourage them to work on would be:  1.  Attention to detail. In my first two visits so far, both times my burrito was wrong. The first time I asked for no beans, but when I got home I learned there were beans. Today I asked for no beans, add guac. Well the no beans happened but no guac either. These are small things but it's not hard to get right- so I hope they will work on attention to detail.   2.  Guacamole quality. I was very surprised to see such poor quality guac. It had a pudding like consistency and zero flavor. It is such a departure since all the food is flavorful and very good quality. I understand avocados are expensive but you can't serve green applesauce and call it guac. If it's that difficult or expensive I would remove it from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. This is the amount of chips you get when you pay $9.00 for guac, chips and salsa. You&#39;re better than that LT.

GDqTNc6tdzELEENDYi9ohA.text: I received a gift certificate from Los Taquitos from some co workers of mine who have said nothing but great things about this place. Im origionally from Cali so ive had some great mexican food and also experience some bad. Ive been to a couple mexican restaurants out here and have not been impressed at all. I decided to cash in my GC and tried their carne asada burrito.  Wow, I thought it was delicious, the meat was tender and juicy and had an equal balance of meat/rice/beans. They look small but believe me, they are extremely filling. I also tried their carnitas and they were delicious as well. I honestly didnt think this place was going to be this good but, i was wrong. I wish they had more options of aguas frescas though. Their salsas are also pretty good. Wish they had a lil better set up of the salsa bar with extra things u can take to go. Overall, great place and will definately come back.

a2qplsr7ON9JGoFyOGBv3w.text: Taco Tuesday is just incredible. Their prices otherwise are also super inexpensive. Great atmosphere. We loved the margaritas too. House margs are on special for Taco Tuesday. They were the right mix of sour and salty. We've had a long run of margaritas that are just ALL sour mix so we were pleasantly surprised here!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

jFPSkaINLgjccGiNKykflg.text: Just moved to this side of town and happy to have found this place. The food is great! I had the asada burrito. The meat was perfect, not that chewy crap. I went on a tuesday for my 1st time and holy cow was it busy. There was limited seating. Had to wait for a table to clear. Will be back!

oImcKJszztGR3ToiD_KLjA.text: Stopped here for the 1st time. Got the asada quesadilla with rice and beans. Food was good and staff was nice. Will definitely be back!

rEvMfTibiCICM4N_h1zeog.text: I thought the tacos and the cheese enchilada al-a-cart I purchased blasted with flavor. Nice job  The only thing I will say where an opportunity exists is the portions. The tacos are VERY small (2 bites) and the enchilada was 3 bites. I realize portion control but I had 2 tacos and an enchilada and I was still hungry walking out of the place. I'm not the smallest guy weight wise but for the price, I thought it could be a bit more meaningful in terms of portion.

9xy83dIMokuUf5gH85mqkA.text: Super fresh bowls, the asada one was too salty but the red chili beef bowl looked like it had hand cut green peppers and onions!  The menu sports a margarita and beer selection with happy hour specials too.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Asada bowl
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beautiful mural inside!

Wdw5dNg0___51bw71iTzMA.text: This was my first visit to any Los Taquitos location.  Overall, not bad...but not great.  I ordered the street tacos (with one asada, one carnitas, and one chicken taco).  The tacos were underwhelming.  The chicken was not tender (perhaps overcooked or sat after cooking).  The carnitas missed the mark as well...the meat was too fatty for my taste.  No complaints about the asada however.    The rice and beans would have been excellent had they been served hot and steamy, instead they were just slightly above luke warm.  To be fair, it was just a soft opening and I'm sure they will improve.  I will be back and will adjust my review after the next visit if I have a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

SqHkQNsXqydxe5lTx8MCvg.text: This is one of the only places I've found in Chandler that has great authentic Mexican food. Coming from Mexico I really missed my tacos and tortas! This has the authentic charcoal-like flavor you get from a street cart. If I could only find a good elote place now..

LPeC-X3KZB5WrvKNsQPyZA.text: Really good food and nice sized portions. I had the breakfast quesadilla with bacon. The tortilla was crisp and light. My dining partners had the menudo. The meat and hominy were cooked well and the broth was rich and flavorful. The only reason they do not get 5 stars is because the tables were all dirty and we had to ask them to clean the tables. Overall, it was a good meal and I will probably be back

pjxi6lsXG8gf-FCklfBlWQ.text: I've never had a problem coming here , my foods always been great . Today I was disappointed ordering a pastor burrito .

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States

sz11MMBHY43GwaRRAdvEYQ.text: Looks just like the other location, hope it tastes the same!   Still going with the terrible music - not sure what they are going for by playing all the songs you hoped to never hear again! Food is totally worth it!  Taco Tuesday's are the best deal in town. $1/ea for their awesome tacos. The carnitas are killer, but try them all for that price!

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Looking fly!

2sjBdeK1PlhKlgVSN4_Kag.text: Carnitas tacos - amazing. This place is always cold - bring a jacket. Food is excellent. Taco Tuesday..'nuff said.

9SqCnzp4FRQRd6oVUQGuqA.text: If you want the best local Mexican grub this is it. My family and I have been coming to this place for over a decade originally going to the Ahwatukee location and now Chandler. Both locations amazing, the food is very authentic and the staff is always so nice. Highly recommend!!

5zM1frKYEQ78YvCPjqNhJw.text: Visited this place for dinner during a business trip since it was near my hotel. It seems to be a local fast food chain. Solid food, several choice and good price. I had the taco platter with three different meats (lengua, al pastor, and steak) and they were all good. Rice was somewhat bland. I can eat here again but wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

YZZ2HN7suMT2dYpN6nfa_A.text: Really aesthetically appealing place near the freeway by my house though the parking is usually super packed since it shares with a few other places nearby. On my most recent visit I grabbed some carne asada and lengua tacos which were really good. I tried both green and red sauces and they didn't wow me in any way but they still provided the extra kick if you like your tacos spicier. I saw that they had some taco tuesday deals and drink specials so I'll definitely be back to take advantage of that.

photos.caption: Photo of Los Taquitos Chandler - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lengua and carne asada
